New Records: Aaron Jones hit ten sixes in an innings, only Chris Gayle has hit more sixes in an innings in the men's T20 World Cup.
Navneet Dhaliwal scored the first half-century for Canada in a T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Aaron Jones scored an unbeaten 94 off 40 balls with ten sixes.
USA won by 7 wickets with 14 balls remaining.
Jones and Gous had a 131-run third-wicket partnership at a run rate of 14.29.
Corey Anderson took 1 wicket for 29 runs in 3 overs, using slower balls effectively.
Navneet Dhaliwal scored 61 runs for Canada.
Nicholas Kirton scored 51 runs for Canada.
Shreyas Movva scored an unbeaten 32 off 16 balls for Canada.
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Jones described USA's style of cricket as 'fearless cricket, positive cricket, smart cricket'.
Post-Match Reflections: USA announced their arrival in the T20 World Cup with a demolition of their rivals Canada in Dallas.
Aaron Jones fittingly finished the chase with a pair of sixes, handing USA their fifth successive win over Canada.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Corey Anderson became the fifth player to represent two different teams at the T20 World Cup.
Canada's seamers got the ball to swing and seam under lights.
